IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO EDUCATE, FORM, AND RENEW MEN AND WOMEN TO "PREACH THE GOSPEL TO THE MOST ABANDONED."
IRS990.MissionDesc: INSPIRED BY THE CHARISM OF THE MISSIONARY OBLATES OF MARY IMMACULATE, OBLATE SCHOOL OF THEOLOGY EDUCATES, FORMS, AND RENEWS MEN AND WOMEN TO "PREACH THE GOSPEL TO THE MOST ABANDONED."
IRS990.Desc: OBLATE SCHOOL OF THEOLOGY (OST) IS AN ACCREDITED CATHOLIC SCHOOL OF THEOLOGY OFFERING GRADUATE LEVEL PROGRAMS IN THEOLOGY, PASTORAL MINISTRY AND DIVINITY, A DOCTOR OF MINISTRY (IN A VARIETY OF FIELDS), AND A PHD PROGRAM IN SPIRITUALITY. OST PREPARES MEN FOR PRIESTHOOD FROM MANY DIOCESES AND RELIGIOUS COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE UNITED STATES AND ABROAD. OST ALSO PREPARES MEN AND WOMEN, RELIGIOUS AS WELL AS LAITY, FROM CATHOLIC AND OTHER CHRISTIAN TRADITIONS FOR A VARIETY OF MINISTRIES. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2022 OST PROVIDED EDUCATIONAL SERVICES FOR APPROXIMATELY 224 STUDENTS IN DEGREE PROGRAMS, 216 STUDENTS IN CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS, AND APPROXIMATELY 4,724 PARTICIPANTS AT 46 CONTINUING EDUCATION EVENTS. OST ISSUED DEGREES TO 24 STUDENTS IN MASTERS PROGRAMS, 3 DOCTORAL PROGRAM STUDENTS, 2 PHD STUDENTS, AND 18 CERTIFICATE STUDENTS IN THE LMI AND IFP PROGRAMS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE MINISTRY TO MINISTERS (MTM) PROGRAM OFFERS ACTIVE MINISTERS A FOUR MONTH PROGRAM OF RENEWAL ADDRESSING THE NEEDS OF BODY, MIND AND SPIRIT. THE MTM PROGRAM IS OFFERED TWICE A YEAR. PARTICIPANTS IN THIS PROGRAM ARE HOUSED IN A FACILITY THAT ACCOMMODATES UP TO 25 PEOPLE AT A TIME. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2022 THE PROGRAM HOSTED 26 PARTICIPANTS AND PROVIDED THEM WITH ROOM AND BOARD, MINI-COURSES AND WORKSHOPS FOCUSED ON THEOLOGICAL UPDATING AND RENEWAL, AS WELL AS TOPICS ON INTEGRATIVE SPIRITUALITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE OBLATE RENEWAL CENTER (ORC) IS A FACILITY FOR RELIGIOUS CONFERENCES, WORKSHOPS, RETREATS, AND SPIRITUAL COUNSELING. THE FACILITIES INCLUDE 3 CONFERENCE ROOMS, SEVERAL SMALLER BREAKOUT ROOMS, LIBRARY, CLASSROOMS AND 60 GUEST ROOMS WITH PRIVATE BATHS. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2022, THE ORC HELD APPROXIMATELY 55 EVENTS RELATED TO RELIGIOUS AND SPIRITUAL CONFERENCES, WORKSHOPS, AND RETREATS AND SERVED AND ACCOMMODATED APPROXIMATELY 4,564 GUESTS DURING THESE EVENTS. ADDITIONALLY, THE ORC RECEIVED $390,396 OF DONATED USE OF FACILITIES WHICH ARE NOT INCLUDED IN THE REVENUE AND EXPENSE REPORTED IN PART III.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN CHARITABLE GIFT ANNUITIES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO SUPPORT ENDOWED CHAIRS, SCHOLARSHIPS, AND UNDERWRITE GENERAL OPERATING COSTS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF ANNUITY TRUST -3,839,115. CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN CGA -48,011.
EXPENSES INCLUDED IN REVENUE ON AFS -696,804.

THE NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY IS PUBLISHED IN THE OST CATALOG ON PAGE 1 AND IS AVAILABLE IN PRINT OR ON-LINE THROUGH THE SCHOOL'S WEBSITE. THE CATALOG IS AVAILABLE TO BOTH CURRENT AND POTENTIAL STUDENTS.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: US PROVINCE OF THE MISSIONARY OBLATES OF IMMACULATE INC

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: AID FOR OBLATE MINISTRY ASSISTING VICTIMS OF WAR IN UKRAINE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE ASSISTANCE TO COMPLETE APPLICATIONS FOR ASSISTANCE AND DEMONSTRATE THEIR NEED. ONCE ASSISTANCE IS RECEIVED BY A STUDENT THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS THE STUDENT TO ENSURE THAT THE COURSES FOR WHICH ASSISTANCE WAS RECEIVED ARE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED.
THE AMOUNT REPORTED IN LINE 17, COLUMN B IS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS.
BROKER/REAL ESTATE AGENTS HIRED TO SELL NON-CASH CONTRIBUTIONS (WHEN APPLICABLE).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE GENERAL SUPERVISION OF THE ADMINISTRATION AND PROPERTY OF THE SCHOOL EXCEPT THAT IT MAY NOT TAKE ANY ACTION INCONSISTENT WITH A SPECIFIC DIRECTION OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, UNLESS SPECIFICALLY EMPOWERED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO DO SO, NOR MAY IT TAKE ANY ACTION WHICH HAS BEEN EXPLICITLY RESERVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE FOLLOWING ARE MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE: SR. JANE ANN SLATER, CDP; MR. MARK WITTIG; REV JIM CHAMBERS, OMI; VERY REV. LOU STUDER, OMI (CHAIR); MR. ROBERT MCADAMS (VICE CHAIR); MR. SCOTT WOODWARD (OST PRESIDENT); AND MR. RENE ESPINOSA, VP OF ADMINISTRATION AND FINANCE, WHO IS NOT AN OFFICAL MEMBER OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, BUT ACTS AS A LIASON BETWEEN THE COMMITTEE AND THE SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS OF THIS CORPORATION SHALL BE THE PROVINCIAL SUPERIOR, THE PROVINCIAL TREASURER AND THOSE CERTAIN QUALIFIED MEMBERS WHO ARE DULY APPOINTED AND/OR AFFIRMED IN COUNCIL AT ANY TIME AND FROM TIME TO TIME BY THE PROVINCIAL SUPERIOR. THE PROVINCIAL SUPERIOR SHALL SERVE AND IS CHAIRPERSON OF THE CORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS OF THIS CORPORATION SHALL BE APPOINTED FROM AMONG THOSE CERTAIN MEMBERS OF THE UNITED STATES PROVINCE OF THE MISSIONARY OBLATES OF MARY IMMACULATE, A RELIGIOUS AND APOSTOLIC CONGREGATION OF THE ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH ("RELIGIOUS CONGREGATION") APPOINTED AND/OR AFFIRMED IN COUNCIL AT ANY TIME AND FROM TIME TO TIME BY THE SUPERIOR GENERAL OF THE RELIGIOUS CONGREGATION TO SERVE IN THE ECCLESIASTICAL OFFICES OF THE PROVINCIAL SUPERIOR, PROVINCIAL COUNCILOR(S) AND THE PROVINCIAL TREASURER ("QUALIFIED MEMBERS").

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOLLOWING ENUMERATED POWERS ARE RESERVED TO THE MEMBERS OF THIS CORPORATION. THE POWER: A. TO APPROVE THE STATED PHILOSOPHY ACCORDING TO WHICH OBLATE SCHOOL OF THEOLOGY OPERATES; B. TO ADOPT AMENDMENTS TO THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION AND TO THE BY-LAWS WHICH ARE PROPOSED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, AND, BY EXCEPTION, TO INITIATE SUCH AMENDMENTS; C. TO ELECT TRUSTEES; D. TO LEASE, SELL, OR ENCUMBER CORPORATE REAL ESTATE AFTER CONSULTATION WITH THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES; E. TO MERGE OR DISSOLVE THE CORPORATION; F. TO APPROVE OR DISAPPROVE THE ELECTION AND/ OR REMOVAL OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE SCHOOL OF THEOLOGY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS PRESENTED TO MEMBERS OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW BEFORE FILING. THE FORM 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE TO ANY BOARD MEMBER UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND VOLUNTEERS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS ALL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS AND ACKNOWLEDGES ANY CONFLICTS IN THE MINUTES OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. BOARD MEMBERS WITH CONFLICTS, IF ANY, ARE REQUIRED TO ABSTAIN FROM DISCUSSION AND VOTING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL EMPLOYEES ARE COMPENSATED BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION, THE OBLATE SERVICE CORPORATION. COMPENSATION IS ESTABLISHED BY THE PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR ADMINISTRATION AND FINANCE WITH FINAL APPROVAL BY THE EXECUTIVE AND FINANCE COMMITTEES OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. SALARY SURVEYS ARE ALSO USED TO DETERMINE SALARY RANGES FOR VARIOUS POSITIONS. THE EXECUTIVE AND FINANCE COMMITTEES REVIEW AND COMPARE EXECUTIVE SALARIES TO SALARY SURVEYS OF INSTITUTIONS OF SIMILAR SIZE OBTAINED FROM ACCREDITING AGENCIES. THE PROCESS FOR REVIEWING THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION BY THE BOARD IS DONE UPON INITIAL HIRING AND/OR IF PRESIDENT REQUESTS A PAY INCREASE. THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION WAS LAST REVIEWED IN FY 2020; HOWEVER, COLA INCREASES ARE APPROVED ANNUALLY DURING THE BUDGET PROCESS AND NEW RATES ARE REFLECTED ON ANNUAL CONTRACT. FURTHER, THE ANNUAL CONTRACT FOR THE PRESIDENT IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD'S TREASURER. ANNUAL COLA INCREASES IN COMPENSATION FOR THE SCHOOL ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD DURING THE BUDGET PROCESS EVERY MARCH.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FORM 990 AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
THE SCHOOL LEASES ITS EMPLOYEES FROM THE OBLATE SERVICE CORPORATION (OSC). THEREFORE, THIS AMOUNT HAS BEEN REPORTED AS 0. FOR THIS REASON COMPENSATION AMOUNTS ARE REPORTED IN COLUMN E OF PART VII.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF OIP CHARITABLE TRUST -3,839,115. CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN CGA -48,011. DEBT FORGIVENESS 1,305,505.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

IdDisregardedEntitiesGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: RECEIPT OF PROPERTY FOR CONTRIBUTION TO CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS
